availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William L. Pearce (Mason County, Kentucky, book merchant and grocer)

body.p: Mason County, Kentucky, book merchant and grocer. Kentucky native. Son of Hiram Pearce and Minerva Pearce. Married to Anna Belle Tieseman Pearce in Mason County, Kentucky, in October 1860. Attended school in Mason County in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Mason County in 1850. Book merchant in Mason County in 1860. Household owned five enslaved persons in Mason County in 1860. Book merchant in W.L. Pearce & Company in Mason County from 1862 to 1863. Grocery and liquor merchant in partnership with James L. Pearce in Mason County in 1864.
